member.name: T:Amazon.ECR.Model.AuthorizationData
member.summary: An object representing authorization data for an Amazon ECR registry.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.AuthorizationData.AuthorizationToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AuthorizationToken.
A base64-encoded string that contains authorization data for the specified Amazon ECR registry. When the string is decoded, it is presented in the format user:password for private registry authentication using docker login.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.AuthorizationData.ExpiresAt
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExpiresAt.
The Unix time in seconds and milliseconds when the authorization token expires. Authorization tokens are valid for 12 hours.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.AuthorizationData.ProxyEndpoint
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ProxyEndpoint.
The registry URL to use for this authorization token in a docker login command. The Amazon ECR registry URL format is https://aws_account_id.dkr.ecr.region.amazonaws.com. For example, https://012345678910.dkr.ecr.us-east-1.amazonaws.com..

member.name: T:Amazon.ECR.Model.BatchCheckLayerAvailabilityRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the BatchCheckLayerAvailability operation. Checks the availability of one or more image layers in a repository.
When an image is pushed to a repository, each image layer is checked to verify if it has been uploaded before. If it has been uploaded, then the image layer is skipped.
This operation is used by the Amazon ECR proxy and is not generally used by customers for pulling and pushing images. In most cases, you should use the docker CLI to pull, tag, and push images.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.BatchCheckLayerAvailabilityRequest.LayerDigests
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LayerDigests.
The digests of the image layers to check.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.BatchCheckLayerAvailabilityRequest.RegistryId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RegistryId.
The Amazon Web Services account ID associated with the registry that contains the image layers to check. If you do not specify a registry, the default registry is assumed.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.BatchCheckLayerAvailabilityRequest.RepositoryName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RepositoryName.
The name of the repository that is associated with the image layers to check.

member.name: T:Amazon.ECR.Model.BatchCheckLayerAvailabilityResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the BatchCheckLayerAvailability operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.BatchCheckLayerAvailabilityResponse.Failures
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Failures.
Any failures associated with the call.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.BatchCheckLayerAvailabilityResponse.Layers
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Layers.
A list of image layer objects corresponding to the image layer references in the request.

member.name: T:Amazon.ECR.Model.BatchDeleteImageRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the BatchDeleteImage operation. Deletes a list of specified images within a repository. Images are specified with either an imageTag or imageDigest.
You can remove a tag from an image by specifying the image's tag in your request. When you remove the last tag from an image, the image is deleted from your repository.
You can completely delete an image (and all of its tags) by specifying the image's digest in your request.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.BatchDeleteImageRequest.ImageIds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ImageIds.
A list of image ID references that correspond to images to delete. The format of the imageIds reference is imageTag=tag or imageDigest=digest.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.BatchDeleteImageRequest.RegistryId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RegistryId.
The Amazon Web Services account ID associated with the registry that contains the image to delete. If you do not specify a registry, the default registry is assumed.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.BatchDeleteImageRequest.RepositoryName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RepositoryName.
The repository that contains the image to delete.

member.name: T:Amazon.ECR.Model.BatchDeleteImageResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the BatchDeleteImage operation.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Failures.
Any failures associated with the call.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.BatchDeleteImageResponse.ImageIds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ImageIds.
The image IDs of the deleted images.

member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the BatchGetImage operation. Gets detailed information for an image. Images are specified with either an imageTag or imageDigest.
When an image is pulled, the BatchGetImage API is called once to retrieve the image manifest.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.BatchGetImageRequest.ImageIds

member.summary:

member.name: T:Amazon.ECR.Model.CompleteLayerUploadRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CompleteLayerUpload operation. Informs Amazon ECR that the image layer upload has completed for a specified registry, repository name, and upload ID. You can optionally provide a sha256 digest of the image layer for data validation purposes.
When an image is pushed, the CompleteLayerUpload API is called once per each new image layer to verify that the upload has completed.
This operation is used by the Amazon ECR proxy and is not generally used by customers for pulling and pushing images. In most cases, you should use the docker CLI to pull, tag, and push images.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.CompleteLayerUploadRequest.LayerDigests
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LayerDigests.
The sha256 digest of the image layer.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.CompleteLayerUploadRequest.RegistryId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RegistryId.
The Amazon Web Services account ID associated with the registry to which to upload layers. If you do not specify a registry, the default registry is assumed.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.CompleteLayerUploadRequest.RepositoryName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RepositoryName.
The name of the repository to associate with the image layer.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.CompleteLayerUploadRequest.UploadId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UploadId.
The upload ID from a previous InitiateLayerUpload operation to associate with the image layer.

member.name: T:Amazon.ECR.Model.CompleteLayerUploadResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the CompleteLayerUpload operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.CompleteLayerUploadResponse.LayerDigest
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LayerDigest.
The sha256 digest of the image layer.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.CompleteLayerUploadResponse.RegistryId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RegistryId.
The registry ID associated with the request.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.CompleteLayerUploadResponse.RepositoryName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RepositoryName.
The repository name associated with the request.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.CompleteLayerUploadResponse.UploadId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UploadId.
The upload ID associated with the layer.

member.name: T:Amazon.ECR.Model.CreateRepositoryRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the CreateRepository operation. Creates a repository. For more information, see Amazon ECR repositories in the Amazon Elastic Container Registry User Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.CreateRepositoryRequest.EncryptionConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EncryptionConfiguration.
The encryption configuration for the repository. This determines how the contents of your repository are encrypted at rest.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.CreateRepositoryRequest.ImageScanningConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ImageScanningConfiguration.
The image scanning configuration for the repository. This determines whether images are scanned for known vulnerabilities after being pushed to the repository.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.CreateRepositoryRequest.ImageTagMutability
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ImageTagMutability.
The tag mutability setting for the repository. If this parameter is omitted, the default setting of MUTABLE will be used which will allow image tags to be overwritten. If IMMUTABLE is specified, all image tags within the repository will be immutable which will prevent them from being overwritten.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.CreateRepositoryRequest.RegistryId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RegistryId.
The AWS account ID associated with the registry to create the repository. If you do not specify a registry, the default registry is assumed.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.CreateRepositoryRequest.RepositoryName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RepositoryName.
The name to use for the repository. The repository name may be specified on its own (such as nginx-web-app) or it can be prepended with a namespace to group the repository into a category (such as project-a/nginx-web-app).

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.CreateRepositoryRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
The metadata that you apply to the repository to help you categorize and organize them. Each tag consists of a key and an optional value, both of which you define. Tag keys can have a maximum character length of 128 characters, and tag values can have a maximum length of 256 characters.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.CreateRepositoryResponse.Repository
member.summary:

The repository that was created.

member.name: T:Amazon.ECR.Model.DescribeImageScanFindingsRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the DescribeImageScanFindings operation. Returns the scan findings for the specified image.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.DescribeImageScanFindingsRequest.ImageId
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ImageId.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.DescribeImageScanFindingsRequest.MaxResults
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxResults.
The maximum number of image scan results returned by DescribeImageScanFindings in paginated output. When this parameter is used, DescribeImageScanFindings only returns maxResults results in a single page along with a nextToken response element. The remaining results of the initial request can be seen by sending another DescribeImageScanFindings request with the returned nextToken value. This value can be between 1 and 1000. If this parameter is not used, then DescribeImageScanFindings returns up to 100 results and a nextToken value, if applicable.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.DescribeImageScanFindingsRequest.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
The nextToken value returned from a previous paginated DescribeImageScanFindings request where maxResults was used and the results exceeded the value of that parameter. Pagination continues from the end of the previous results that returned the nextToken value. This value is null when there are no more results to return.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.DescribeImageScanFindingsRequest.RegistryId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RegistryId.
The Amazon Web Services account ID associated with the registry that contains the repository in which to describe the image scan findings for. If you do not specify a registry, the default registry is assumed.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.DescribeImageScanFindingsRequest.RepositoryName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RepositoryName.
The repository for the image for which to describe the scan findings.

member.summary:

The current state of the scan.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.DescribeImageScanFindingsResponse.NextToken

The nextToken value to include in a future DescribeImageScanFindings request. When the results of a DescribeImageScanFindings request exceed maxResults, this value can be used to retrieve the next page of results. This value is null when there are no more results to return.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.DescribeImageScanFindingsResponse.RegistryId

member.name: T:Amazon.ECR.Model.DescribeImagesFilter
member.summary: An object representing a filter on a DescribeImages operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.DescribeImagesFilter.TagStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TagStatus.
The tag status with which to filter your DescribeImages results. You can filter results based on whether they are TAGGED or UNTAGGED.

member.name: T:Amazon.ECR.Model.DescribeImagesRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the DescribeImages operation. Returns metadata about the images in a repository.
Beginning with Docker version 1.9, the Docker client compresses image layers before pushing them to a V2 Docker registry. The output of the docker images command shows the uncompressed image size, so it may return a larger image size than the image sizes returned by DescribeImages.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.DescribeImagesRequest.Filter
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Filter.
The filter key and value with which to filter your DescribeImages results.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.DescribeImagesRequest.ImageIds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ImageIds.
The list of image IDs for the requested repository.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.DescribeImagesRequest.MaxResults
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxResults.
The maximum number of repository results returned by DescribeImages in paginated output. When this parameter is used, DescribeImages only returns maxResults results in a single page along with a nextToken response element. The remaining results of the initial request can be seen by sending another DescribeImages request with the returned nextToken value. This value can be between 1 and 1000. If this parameter is not used, then DescribeImages returns up to 100 results and a nextToken value, if applicable. This option cannot be used when you specify images with imageIds.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.DescribeImagesRequest.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
The nextToken value returned from a previous paginated DescribeImages request where maxResults was used and the results exceeded the value of that parameter. Pagination continues from the end of the previous results that returned the nextToken value. This value is null when there are no more results to return. This option cannot be used when you specify images with imageIds.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.DescribeImagesRequest.RegistryId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RegistryId.
The Amazon Web Services account ID associated with the registry that contains the repository in which to describe images. If you do not specify a registry, the default registry is assumed.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.DescribeImagesRequest.RepositoryName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RepositoryName.
The repository that contains the images to describe.

member.name: T:Amazon.ECR.Model.DescribeImagesResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DescribeImages operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.DescribeImagesResponse.ImageDetails
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ImageDetails.
A list of ImageDetail objects that contain data about the image.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.DescribeImagesResponse.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
The nextToken value to include in a future DescribeImages request. When the results of a DescribeImages request exceed maxResults, this value can be used to retrieve the next page of results. This value is null when there are no more results to return.

member.name: T:Amazon.ECR.Model.DescribeRegistryRequest

member.summary: This is the response object from the DescribeRegistry operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.DescribeRegistryResponse.RegistryId

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.DescribeRegistryResponse.ReplicationConfiguration
member.summary:

member.name: T:Amazon.ECR.Model.DescribeRepositoriesRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the DescribeRepositories operation. Describes image repositories in a registry.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.DescribeRepositoriesRequest.MaxResults
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxResults.
The maximum number of repository results returned by DescribeRepositories in paginated output. When this parameter is used, DescribeRepositories only returns maxResults results in a single page along with a nextToken response element. The remaining results of the initial request can be seen by sending another DescribeRepositories request with the returned nextToken value. This value can be between 1 and 1000. If this parameter is not used, then DescribeRepositories returns up to 100 results and a nextToken value, if applicable. This option cannot be used when you specify repositories with repositoryNames.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.DescribeRepositoriesRequest.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
The nextToken value returned from a previous paginated DescribeRepositories request where maxResults was used and the results exceeded the value of that parameter. Pagination continues from the end of the previous results that returned the nextToken value. This value is null when there are no more results to return. This option cannot be used when you specify repositories with repositoryNames.
This token should be treated as an opaque identifier that is only used to retrieve the next items in a list and not for other programmatic purposes.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.DescribeRepositoriesRequest.RegistryId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RegistryId.
The Amazon Web Services account ID associated with the registry that contains the repositories to be described. If you do not specify a registry, the default registry is assumed.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.DescribeRepositoriesRequest.RepositoryNames
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RepositoryNames.
A list of repositories to describe. If this parameter is omitted, then all repositories in a registry are described.

member.name: T:Amazon.ECR.Model.DescribeRepositoriesResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DescribeRepositories operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.DescribeRepositoriesResponse.NextToken
member.summary:

member.name: T:Amazon.ECR.Model.EncryptionConfiguration
member.summary:
The encryption configuration for the repository. This determines how the contents of your repository are encrypted at rest.
By default, when no encryption configuration is set or the AES256 encryption type is used, Amazon ECR uses server-side encryption with Amazon S3-managed encryption keys which encrypts your data at rest using an AES-256 encryption algorithm. This does not require any action on your part.
For more control over the encryption of the contents of your repository, you can use server-side encryption with Key Management Service key stored in Key Management Service (KMS) to encrypt your images. For more information, see Amazon ECR encryption at rest in the Amazon Elastic Container Registry User Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.EncryptionConfiguration.EncryptionType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EncryptionType.
The encryption type to use.
If you use the KMS encryption type, the contents of the repository will be encrypted using server-side encryption with Key Management Service key stored in KMS. When you use KMS to encrypt your data, you can either use the default Amazon Web Services managed KMS key for Amazon ECR, or specify your own KMS key, which you already created. For more information, see Protecting data using server-side encryption with an KMS key stored in Key Management Service (SSE-KMS) in the Amazon Simple Storage Service Console Developer Guide..
If you use the AES256 encryption type, Amazon ECR uses server-side encryption with Amazon S3-managed encryption keys which encrypts the images in the repository using an AES-256 encryption algorithm. For more information, see Protecting data using server-side encryption with Amazon S3-managed encryption keys (SSE-S3) in the Amazon Simple Storage Service Console Developer Guide..

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.EncryptionConfiguration.KmsKey
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property KmsKey.
If you use the KMS encryption type, specify the KMS key to use for encryption. The alias, key ID, or full ARN of the KMS key can be specified. The key must exist in the same Region as the repository. If no key is specified, the default Amazon Web Services managed KMS key for Amazon ECR will be used.

member.name: T:Amazon.ECR.Model.GetAuthorizationTokenRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the GetAuthorizationToken operation. Retrieves an authorization token. An authorization token represents your IAM authentication credentials and can be used to access any Amazon ECR registry that your IAM principal has access to. The authorization token is valid for 12 hours.
The authorizationToken returned is a base64 encoded string that can be decoded and used in a docker login command to authenticate to a registry. The CLI offers an get-login-password command that simplifies the login process. For more information, see Registry authentication in the Amazon Elastic Container Registry User Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.GetAuthorizationTokenRequest.RegistryIds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RegistryIds.
A list of Amazon Web Services account IDs that are associated with the registries for which to get AuthorizationData objects. If you do not specify a registry, the default registry is assumed.

member.name: T:Amazon.ECR.Model.GetAuthorizationTokenResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the GetAuthorizationToken operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.GetAuthorizationTokenResponse.AuthorizationData
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AuthorizationData.
A list of authorization token data objects that correspond to the registryIds values in the request.

member.name: T:Amazon.ECR.Model.GetDownloadUrlForLayerRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the GetDownloadUrlForLayer operation. Retrieves the pre-signed Amazon S3 download URL corresponding to an image layer. You can only get URLs for image layers that are referenced in an image.
When an image is pulled, the GetDownloadUrlForLayer API is called once per image layer that is not already cached.
This operation is used by the Amazon ECR proxy and is not generally used by customers for pulling and pushing images. In most cases, you should use the docker CLI to pull, tag, and push images.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.GetDownloadUrlForLayerRequest.LayerDigest

The digest of the image layer to download.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.GetDownloadUrlForLayerRequest.RegistryId
member.summary:

The Amazon Web Services account ID associated with the registry that contains the image layer to download. If you do not specify a registry, the default registry is assumed.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.GetDownloadUrlForLayerRequest.RepositoryName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RepositoryName.
The name of the repository that is associated with the image layer to download.

member.summary: Container for the parameters to the GetLifecyclePolicyPreview operation. Retrieves the results of the lifecycle policy preview request for the specified repository.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.GetLifecyclePolicyPreviewRequest.Filter
member.summary:

An optional parameter that filters results based on image tag status and all tags, if tagged.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ImageIds.
The list of imageIDs to be included.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.GetLifecyclePolicyPreviewRequest.MaxResults
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxResults.
The maximum number of repository results returned by GetLifecyclePolicyPreviewRequest in paginated output. When this parameter is used, GetLifecyclePolicyPreviewRequest only returns maxResults results in a single page along with a nextToken response element. The remaining results of the initial request can be seen by sending another GetLifecyclePolicyPreviewRequest request with the returned nextToken value. This value can be between 1 and 1000. If this parameter is not used, then GetLifecyclePolicyPreviewRequest returns up to 100 results and a nextToken value, if applicable. This option cannot be used when you specify images with imageIds.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.GetLifecyclePolicyPreviewRequest.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
The nextToken value returned from a previous paginated GetLifecyclePolicyPreviewRequest request where maxResults was used and the results exceeded the value of that parameter. Pagination continues from the end of the previous results that returned the nextToken value. This value is null when there are no more results to return. This option cannot be used when you specify images with imageIds.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ImageSizeInBytes.

If the image is a manifest list, this will be the max size of all manifests in the list.
Beginning with Docker version 1.9, the Docker client compresses image layers before pushing them to a V2 Docker registry. The output of the docker images command shows the uncompressed image size, so it may return a larger image size than the image sizes returned by DescribeImages.

member.name: T:Amazon.ECR.Model.InitiateLayerUploadRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the InitiateLayerUpload operation. Notifies Amazon ECR that you intend to upload an image layer.
When an image is pushed, the InitiateLayerUpload API is called once per image layer that has not already been uploaded. Whether or not an image layer has been uploaded is determined by the BatchCheckLayerAvailability API action.
This operation is used by the Amazon ECR proxy and is not generally used by customers for pulling and pushing images. In most cases, you should use the docker CLI to pull, tag, and push images.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.InitiateLayerUploadRequest.RegistryId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RegistryId.
The Amazon Web Services account ID associated with the registry to which you intend to upload layers. If you do not specify a registry, the default registry is assumed.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.InitiateLayerUploadRequest.RepositoryName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RepositoryName.
The name of the repository to which you intend to upload layers.

member.name: T:Amazon.ECR.Model.InitiateLayerUploadResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the InitiateLayerUpload operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.InitiateLayerUploadResponse.PartSize
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PartSize.
The size, in bytes, that Amazon ECR expects future layer part uploads to be.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.InitiateLayerUploadResponse.UploadId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UploadId.
The upload ID for the layer upload. This parameter is passed to further UploadLayerPart and CompleteLayerUpload operations.

member.name: T:Amazon.ECR.Model.ListImagesFilter
member.summary: An object representing a filter on a ListImages operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.ListImagesFilter.TagStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TagStatus.
The tag status with which to filter your ListImages results. You can filter results based on whether they are TAGGED or UNTAGGED.

member.name: T:Amazon.ECR.Model.ListImagesRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the ListImages operation. Lists all the image IDs for the specified repository.
You can filter images based on whether or not they are tagged by using the tagStatus filter and specifying either TAGGED, UNTAGGED or ANY. For example, you can filter your results to return only UNTAGGED images and then pipe that result to a BatchDeleteImage operation to delete them. Or, you can filter your results to return only TAGGED images to list all of the tags in your repository.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.ListImagesRequest.Filter
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Filter.
The filter key and value with which to filter your ListImages results.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.ListImagesRequest.MaxResults
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxResults.
The maximum number of image results returned by ListImages in paginated output. When this parameter is used, ListImages only returns maxResults results in a single page along with a nextToken response element. The remaining results of the initial request can be seen by sending another ListImages request with the returned nextToken value. This value can be between 1 and 1000. If this parameter is not used, then ListImages returns up to 100 results and a nextToken value, if applicable.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.ListImagesRequest.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
The nextToken value returned from a previous paginated ListImages request where maxResults was used and the results exceeded the value of that parameter. Pagination continues from the end of the previous results that returned the nextToken value. This value is null when there are no more results to return.
This token should be treated as an opaque identifier that is only used to retrieve the next items in a list and not for other programmatic purposes.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.ListImagesRequest.RegistryId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RegistryId.
The Amazon Web Services account ID associated with the registry that contains the repository in which to list images. If you do not specify a registry, the default registry is assumed.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.ListImagesRequest.RepositoryName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RepositoryName.
The repository with image IDs to be listed.

member.name: T:Amazon.ECR.Model.ListImagesResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the ListImages operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.ListImagesResponse.ImageIds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ImageIds.
The list of image IDs for the requested repository.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.ListImagesResponse.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
The nextToken value to include in a future ListImages request. When the results of a ListImages request exceed maxResults, this value can be used to retrieve the next page of results. This value is null when there are no more results to return.

member.name: T:Amazon.ECR.Model.ListTagsForResourceRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the ListTagsForResource operation. List the tags for an Amazon ECR resource.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.ListTagsForResourceRequest.ResourceArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that identifies the resource for which to list the tags. Currently, the only supported resource is an Amazon ECR repository.

member.name: T:Amazon.ECR.Model.ListTagsForResourceResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the ListTagsForResource operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.ListTagsForResourceResponse.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
The tags for the resource.

member.name: T:Amazon.ECR.Model.PutImageRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the PutImage operation. Creates or updates the image manifest and tags associated with an image.
When an image is pushed and all new image layers have been uploaded, the PutImage API is called once to create or update the image manifest and the tags associated with the image.
This operation is used by the Amazon ECR proxy and is not generally used by customers for pulling and pushing images. In most cases, you should use the docker CLI to pull, tag, and push images.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.PutImageRequest.ImageDigest
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ImageDigest.

member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.PutImageTagMutabilityRequest.ImageTagMutability
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ImageTagMutability.
The tag mutability setting for the repository. If MUTABLE is specified, image tags can be overwritten. If IMMUTABLE is specified, all image tags within the repository will be immutable which will prevent them from being overwritten.

member.name: T:Amazon.ECR.Model.PutRegistryPolicyRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the PutRegistryPolicy operation. Creates or updates the permissions policy for your registry.
A registry policy is used to specify permissions for another Amazon Web Services account and is used when configuring cross-account replication. For more information, see Registry permissions in the Amazon Elastic Container Registry User Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.PutRegistryPolicyRequest.PolicyText
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PolicyText.
The JSON policy text to apply to your registry. The policy text follows the same format as IAM policy text. For more information, see Registry permissions in the Amazon Elastic Container Registry User Guide.

member.name: T:Amazon.ECR.Model.PutRegistryPolicyResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the PutRegistryPolicy operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.PutRegistryPolicyResponse.PolicyText
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PolicyText.
The JSON policy text for your registry.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.PutRegistryPolicyResponse.RegistryId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RegistryId.
The registry ID.

member.name: T:Amazon.ECR.Model.PutReplicationConfigurationRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the PutReplicationConfiguration operation. Creates or updates the replication configuration for a registry. The existing replication configuration for a repository can be retrieved with the DescribeRegistry API action. The first time the PutReplicationConfiguration API is called, a service-linked IAM role is created in your account for the replication process. For more information, see Using service-linked roles for Amazon ECR in the Amazon Elastic Container Registry User Guide.
When configuring cross-account replication, the destination account must grant the source account permission to replicate. This permission is controlled using a registry permissions policy. For more information, see PutRegistryPolicy.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.PutReplicationConfigurationRequest.ReplicationConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReplicationConfiguration.
An object representing the replication configuration for a registry.

member.name: T:Amazon.ECR.Model.PutReplicationConfigurationResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the PutReplicationConfiguration operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.PutReplicationConfigurationResponse.ReplicationConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReplicationConfiguration.
The contents of the replication configuration for the registry.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.ReplicationDestination.Region
member.summary:

The Region to replicate to.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.ReplicationDestination.RegistryId
member.summary:

The Amazon Web Services account ID of the Amazon ECR private registry to replicate to. When configuring cross-Region replication within your own registry, specify your own account ID.

member.name: T:Amazon.ECR.Model.ReplicationRule
member.summary: An array of objects representing the replication destinations and repository filters for a replication configuration.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.ReplicationRule.Destinations
member.summary:

An array of objects representing the destination for a replication rule.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.ReplicationRule.RepositoryFilters
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RepositoryFilters.
An array of objects representing the filters for a replication rule. Specifying a repository filter for a replication rule provides a method for controlling which repositories in a private registry are replicated.

member.summary: An object representing a repository.

member.summary:

The date and time, in JavaScript date format, when the repository was created.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.Repository.RepositoryArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RepositoryArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that identifies the repository. The ARN contains the arn:aws:ecr namespace, followed by the region of the repository, Amazon Web Services account ID of the repository owner, repository namespace, and repository name. For example, arn:aws:ecr:region:012345678910:repository/test.

member.summary: The filter settings used with image replication. Specifying a repository filter to a replication rule provides a method for controlling which repositories in a private registry are replicated. If no repository filter is specified, all images in the repository are replicated.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Filter.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.RepositoryFilter.FilterType
member.summary:

The repository filter type. The only supported value is PREFIX_MATCH, which is a repository name prefix specified with the filter parameter.

member.name: T:Amazon.ECR.Model.SetRepositoryPolicyRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the SetRepositoryPolicy operation. Applies a repository policy to the specified repository to control access permissions. For more information, see Amazon ECR Repository policies in the Amazon Elastic Container Registry User Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.SetRepositoryPolicyRequest.Force
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Force.
If the policy you are attempting to set on a repository policy would prevent you from setting another policy in the future, you must force the SetRepositoryPolicy operation. This is intended to prevent accidental repository lock outs.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.SetRepositoryPolicyRequest.PolicyText
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PolicyText.
The JSON repository policy text to apply to the repository. For more information, see Amazon ECR repository policies in the Amazon Elastic Container Registry User Guide.

member.name: T:Amazon.ECR.Model.Tag
member.summary: The metadata that you apply to a resource to help you categorize and organize them. Each tag consists of a key and an optional value, both of which you define. Tag keys can have a maximum character length of 128 characters, and tag values can have a maximum length of 256 characters.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.Tag.Key
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Key.
One part of a key-value pair that make up a tag. A key is a general label that acts like a category for more specific tag values.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.Tag.Value
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Value.
The optional part of a key-value pair that make up a tag. A value acts as a descriptor within a tag category (key).

member.name: T:Amazon.ECR.Model.TagResourceRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the TagResource operation. Adds specified tags to a resource with the specified ARN. Existing tags on a resource are not changed if they are not specified in the request parameters.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.TagResourceRequest.ResourceArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the the resource to which to add tags. Currently, the only supported resource is an Amazon ECR repository.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.TagResourceRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
The tags to add to the resource. A tag is an array of key-value pairs. Tag keys can have a maximum character length of 128 characters, and tag values can have a maximum length of 256 characters.

member.summary: This is the response object from the TagResource operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.ECR.Model.UploadLayerPartRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the UploadLayerPart operation. Uploads an image layer part to Amazon ECR.
When an image is pushed, each new image layer is uploaded in parts. The maximum size of each image layer part can be 20971520 bytes (or about 20MB). The UploadLayerPart API is called once per each new image layer part.
This operation is used by the Amazon ECR proxy and is not generally used by customers for pulling and pushing images. In most cases, you should use the docker CLI to pull, tag, and push images.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.UploadLayerPartRequest.LayerPartBlob
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LayerPartBlob.
The base64-encoded layer part payload.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.UploadLayerPartRequest.PartFirstByte
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PartFirstByte.
The position of the first byte of the layer part witin the overall image layer.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.UploadLayerPartRequest.PartLastByte
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PartLastByte.
The position of the last byte of the layer part within the overall image layer.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.UploadLayerPartRequest.RegistryId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RegistryId.
The Amazon Web Services account ID associated with the registry to which you are uploading layer parts. If you do not specify a registry, the default registry is assumed.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.UploadLayerPartRequest.RepositoryName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RepositoryName.
The name of the repository to which you are uploading layer parts.

member.name: P:Amazon.ECR.Model.UploadLayerPartRequest.UploadId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UploadId.
The upload ID from a previous InitiateLayerUpload operation to associate with the layer part upload.

member.name: T:Amazon.ECR.AmazonECRClient
member.summary:
Implementation for accessing ECR
Amazon Elastic Container Registry
Amazon Elastic Container Registry (Amazon ECR) is a managed container image registry service. Customers can use the familiar Docker CLI, or their preferred client, to push, pull, and manage images. Amazon ECR provides a secure, scalable, and reliable registry for your Docker or Open Container Initiative (OCI) images. Amazon ECR supports private repositories with resource-based permissions using IAM so that specific users or Amazon EC2 instances can access repositories and images.
Amazon ECR has service endpoints in each supported Region. For more information, see Amazon ECR endpoints in the Amazon Web Services General Reference.

member.name: M:Amazon.ECR.AmazonECRClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonECRClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: M:Amazon.ECR.AmazonECRClient.BatchCheckLayerAvailability(Amazon.ECR.Model.BatchCheckLayerAvailabilityRequest)
member.summary:
Checks the availability of one or more image layers in a repository.
When an image is pushed to a repository, each image layer is checked to verify if it has been uploaded before. If it has been uploaded, then the image layer is skipped.
This operation is used by the Amazon ECR proxy and is not generally used by customers for pulling and pushing images. In most cases, you should use the docker CLI to pull, tag, and push images.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the BatchCheckLayerAvailability service method.
member.returns: The response from the BatchCheckLayerAvailability service method, as returned by ECR.
member.exception: The specified parameter is invalid. Review the available parameters for the API request.
The specified repository could not be found. Check the spelling of the specified repository and ensure that you are performing operations on the correct registry.
These errors are usually caused by a server-side issue.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for BatchCheckLayerAvailability Operation

member.summary:
Checks the availability of one or more image layers in a repository.
When an image is pushed to a repository, each image layer is checked to verify if it has been uploaded before. If it has been uploaded, then the image layer is skipped.
This operation is used by the Amazon ECR proxy and is not generally used by customers for pulling and pushing images. In most cases, you should use the docker CLI to pull, tag, and push images.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the BatchCheckLayerAvailability service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.

member.name: M:Amazon.ECR.AmazonECRClient.BatchDeleteImage(Amazon.ECR.Model.BatchDeleteImageRequest)
member.summary:
Deletes a list of specified images within a repository. Images are specified with either an imageTag or imageDigest.
You can remove a tag from an image by specifying the image's tag in your request. When you remove the last tag from an image, the image is deleted from your repository.
You can completely delete an image (and all of its tags) by specifying the image's digest in your request.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the BatchDeleteImage service method.
member.returns: The response from the BatchDeleteImage service method, as returned by ECR.
member.exception: The specified parameter is invalid. Review the available parameters for the API request.
The specified repository could not be found. Check the spelling of the specified repository and ensure that you are performing operations on the correct registry.
These errors are usually caused by a server-side issue.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for BatchDeleteImage Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.ECR.AmazonECRClient.CompleteLayerUpload(Amazon.ECR.Model.CompleteLayerUploadRequest)
member.summary:
Informs Amazon ECR that the image layer upload has completed for a specified registry, repository name, and upload ID. You can optionally provide a sha256 digest of the image layer for data validation purposes.
When an image is pushed, the CompleteLayerUpload API is called once per each new image layer to verify that the upload has completed.
This operation is used by the Amazon ECR proxy and is not generally used by customers for pulling and pushing images. In most cases, you should use the docker CLI to pull, tag, and push images.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the CompleteLayerUpload service method.
member.returns: The response from the CompleteLayerUpload service method, as returned by ECR.
member.exception: The specified layer upload does not contain any layer parts.
The layer digest calculation performed by Amazon ECR upon receipt of the image layer does not match the digest specified.
The specified parameter is invalid. Review the available parameters for the API request.
The operation failed due to a KMS exception.
The image layer already exists in the associated repository.
Layer parts must be at least 5 MiB in size.
The specified repository could not be found. Check the spelling of the specified repository and ensure that you are performing operations on the correct registry.
These errors are usually caused by a server-side issue.
The upload could not be found, or the specified upload ID is not valid for this repository.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for CompleteLayerUpload Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.ECR.AmazonECRClient.DeleteRepository(Amazon.ECR.Model.DeleteRepositoryRequest)
member.summary: Deletes a repository. If the repository contains images, you must either delete all images in the repository or use the force option to delete the repository.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the DeleteRepository service method.
member.returns: The response from the DeleteRepository service method, as returned by ECR.
member.exception: The specified parameter is invalid. Review the available parameters for the API request.
The operation failed due to a KMS exception.
The specified repository contains images. To delete a repository that contains images, you must force the deletion with the force parameter.
The specified repository could not be found. Check the spelling of the specified repository and ensure that you are performing operations on the correct registry.
These errors are usually caused by a server-side issue.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for DeleteRepository Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.ECR.AmazonECRClient.DescribeImages(Amazon.ECR.Model.DescribeImagesRequest)
member.summary:
Returns metadata about the images in a repository.
Beginning with Docker version 1.9, the Docker client compresses image layers before pushing them to a V2 Docker registry. The output of the docker images command shows the uncompressed image size, so it may return a larger image size than the image sizes returned by DescribeImages.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the DescribeImages service method.
member.returns: The response from the DescribeImages service method, as returned by ECR.
member.exception: The image requested does not exist in the specified repository.
The specified parameter is invalid. Review the available parameters for the API request.
The specified repository could not be found. Check the spelling of the specified repository and ensure that you are performing operations on the correct registry.
These errors are usually caused by a server-side issue.

member.name: M:Amazon.ECR.AmazonECRClient.GetAuthorizationToken(Amazon.ECR.Model.GetAuthorizationTokenRequest)
member.summary:
Retrieves an authorization token. An authorization token represents your IAM authentication credentials and can be used to access any Amazon ECR registry that your IAM principal has access to. The authorization token is valid for 12 hours.
The authorizationToken returned is a base64 encoded string that can be decoded and used in a docker login command to authenticate to a registry. The CLI offers an get-login-password command that simplifies the login process. For more information, see Registry authentication in the Amazon Elastic Container Registry User Guide.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the GetAuthorizationToken service method.
member.returns: The response from the GetAuthorizationToken service method, as returned by ECR.
member.exception: The specified parameter is invalid. Review the available parameters for the API request.
These errors are usually caused by a server-side issue.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for GetAuthorizationToken Operation

The CLI offers an get-login-password command that simplifies the login process. For more information, see Registry authentication in the Amazon Elastic Container Registry User Guide.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the GetAuthorizationToken service method.

member.name: M:Amazon.ECR.AmazonECRClient.GetDownloadUrlForLayer(Amazon.ECR.Model.GetDownloadUrlForLayerRequest)
member.summary:
Retrieves the pre-signed Amazon S3 download URL corresponding to an image layer. You can only get URLs for image layers that are referenced in an image.
When an image is pulled, the GetDownloadUrlForLayer API is called once per image layer that is not already cached.
This operation is used by the Amazon ECR proxy and is not generally used by customers for pulling and pushing images. In most cases, you should use the docker CLI to pull, tag, and push images.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the GetDownloadUrlForLayer service method.
member.returns: The response from the GetDownloadUrlForLayer service method, as returned by ECR.
member.exception: The specified parameter is invalid. Review the available parameters for the API request.
The specified layer is not available because it is not associated with an image. Unassociated image layers may be cleaned up at any time.
The specified layers could not be found, or the specified layer is not valid for this repository.
The specified repository could not be found. Check the spelling of the specified repository and ensure that you are performing operations on the correct registry.
These errors are usually caused by a server-side issue.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for GetDownloadUrlForLayer Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.ECR.AmazonECRClient.InitiateLayerUpload(Amazon.ECR.Model.InitiateLayerUploadRequest)
member.summary:
Notifies Amazon ECR that you intend to upload an image layer.
When an image is pushed, the InitiateLayerUpload API is called once per image layer that has not already been uploaded. Whether or not an image layer has been uploaded is determined by the BatchCheckLayerAvailability API action.
This operation is used by the Amazon ECR proxy and is not generally used by customers for pulling and pushing images. In most cases, you should use the docker CLI to pull, tag, and push images.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the InitiateLayerUpload service method.
member.returns: The response from the InitiateLayerUpload service method, as returned by ECR.
member.exception: The specified parameter is invalid. Review the available parameters for the API request.
The operation failed due to a KMS exception.
The specified repository could not be found. Check the spelling of the specified repository and ensure that you are performing operations on the correct registry.
These errors are usually caused by a server-side issue.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for InitiateLayerUpload Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.ECR.AmazonECRClient.ListImages(Amazon.ECR.Model.ListImagesRequest)
member.summary:
Lists all the image IDs for the specified repository.
You can filter images based on whether or not they are tagged by using the tagStatus filter and specifying either TAGGED, UNTAGGED or ANY. For example, you can filter your results to return only UNTAGGED images and then pipe that result to a BatchDeleteImage operation to delete them. Or, you can filter your results to return only TAGGED images to list all of the tags in your repository.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the ListImages service method.
member.returns: The response from the ListImages service method, as returned by ECR.
member.exception: The specified parameter is invalid. Review the available parameters for the API request.
The specified repository could not be found. Check the spelling of the specified repository and ensure that you are performing operations on the correct registry.
These errors are usually caused by a server-side issue.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for ListImages Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.ECR.AmazonECRClient.PutImage(Amazon.ECR.Model.PutImageRequest)
member.summary:
Creates or updates the image manifest and tags associated with an image.
When an image is pushed and all new image layers have been uploaded, the PutImage API is called once to create or update the image manifest and the tags associated with the image.
This operation is used by the Amazon ECR proxy and is not generally used by customers for pulling and pushing images. In most cases, you should use the docker CLI to pull, tag, and push images.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the PutImage service method.
member.returns: The response from the PutImage service method, as returned by ECR.
member.exception: The specified image has already been pushed, and there were no changes to the manifest or image tag after the last push.
The specified image digest does not match the digest that Amazon ECR calculated for the image.
The specified image is tagged with a tag that already exists. The repository is configured for tag immutability.
The specified parameter is invalid. Review the available parameters for the API request.
The operation failed due to a KMS exception.
The specified layers could not be found, or the specified layer is not valid for this repository.
The operation did not succeed because it would have exceeded a service limit for your account. For more information, see Amazon ECR service quotas in the Amazon Elastic Container Registry User Guide.
The manifest list is referencing an image that does not exist.
The specified repository could not be found. Check the spelling of the specified repository and ensure that you are performing operations on the correct registry.
These errors are usually caused by a server-side issue.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for PutImage Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.ECR.AmazonECRClient.PutReplicationConfiguration(Amazon.ECR.Model.PutReplicationConfigurationRequest)
member.summary:
Creates or updates the replication configuration for a registry. The existing replication configuration for a repository can be retrieved with the DescribeRegistry API action. The first time the PutReplicationConfiguration API is called, a service-linked IAM role is created in your account for the replication process. For more information, see Using service-linked roles for Amazon ECR in the Amazon Elastic Container Registry User Guide.
When configuring cross-account replication, the destination account must grant the source account permission to replicate. This permission is controlled using a registry permissions policy. For more information, see PutRegistryPolicy.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the PutReplicationConfiguration service method.
member.returns: The response from the PutReplicationConfiguration service method, as returned by ECR.

member.name: M:Amazon.ECR.AmazonECRClient.UploadLayerPart(Amazon.ECR.Model.UploadLayerPartRequest)
member.summary:
Uploads an image layer part to Amazon ECR.
When an image is pushed, each new image layer is uploaded in parts. The maximum size of each image layer part can be 20971520 bytes (or about 20MB). The UploadLayerPart API is called once per each new image layer part.
This operation is used by the Amazon ECR proxy and is not generally used by customers for pulling and pushing images. In most cases, you should use the docker CLI to pull, tag, and push images.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the UploadLayerPart service method.
member.returns: The response from the UploadLayerPart service method, as returned by ECR.
member.exception: The layer part size is not valid, or the first byte specified is not consecutive to the last byte of a previous layer part upload.
The specified parameter is invalid. Review the available parameters for the API request.
The operation failed due to a KMS exception.
The operation did not succeed because it would have exceeded a service limit for your account. For more information, see Amazon ECR service quotas in the Amazon Elastic Container Registry User Guide.
The specified repository could not be found. Check the spelling of the specified repository and ensure that you are performing operations on the correct registry.
These errors are usually caused by a server-side issue.
The upload could not be found, or the specified upload ID is not valid for this repository.

member.name: T:Amazon.ECR.IAmazonECR
member.summary:
Interface for accessing ECR
Amazon Elastic Container Registry
Amazon Elastic Container Registry (Amazon ECR) is a managed container image registry service. Customers can use the familiar Docker CLI, or their preferred client, to push, pull, and manage images. Amazon ECR provides a secure, scalable, and reliable registry for your Docker or Open Container Initiative (OCI) images. Amazon ECR supports private repositories with resource-based permissions using IAM so that specific users or Amazon EC2 instances can access repositories and images.
Amazon ECR has service endpoints in each supported Region. For more information, see Amazon ECR endpoints in the Amazon Web Services General Reference.

member.summary: Paginators for the service

member.name: M:Amazon.ECR.IAmazonECR.BatchCheckLayerAvailability(Amazon.ECR.Model.BatchCheckLayerAvailabilityRequest)
member.summary:
Checks the availability of one or more image layers in a repository.
When an image is pushed to a repository, each image layer is checked to verify if it has been uploaded before. If it has been uploaded, then the image layer is skipped.
This operation is used by the Amazon ECR proxy and is not generally used by customers for pulling and pushing images. In most cases, you should use the docker CLI to pull, tag, and push images.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the BatchCheckLayerAvailability service method.
member.returns: The response from the BatchCheckLayerAvailability service method, as returned by ECR.
member.exception: The specified parameter is invalid. Review the available parameters for the API request.

These errors are usually caused by a server-side issue.

member.name: M:Amazon.ECR.IAmazonECR.BatchDeleteImage(Amazon.ECR.Model.BatchDeleteImageRequest)
member.summary:
Deletes a list of specified images within a repository. Images are specified with either an imageTag or imageDigest.
You can remove a tag from an image by specifying the image's tag in your request. When you remove the last tag from an image, the image is deleted from your repository.
You can completely delete an image (and all of its tags) by specifying the image's digest in your request.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the BatchDeleteImage service method.
member.returns: The response from the BatchDeleteImage service method, as returned by ECR.

member.name: M:Amazon.ECR.IAmazonECR.CompleteLayerUpload(Amazon.ECR.Model.CompleteLayerUploadRequest)
member.summary:
Informs Amazon ECR that the image layer upload has completed for a specified registry, repository name, and upload ID. You can optionally provide a sha256 digest of the image layer for data validation purposes.
When an image is pushed, the CompleteLayerUpload API is called once per each new image layer to verify that the upload has completed.
This operation is used by the Amazon ECR proxy and is not generally used by customers for pulling and pushing images. In most cases, you should use the docker CLI to pull, tag, and push images.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the CompleteLayerUpload service method.
member.returns: The response from the CompleteLayerUpload service method, as returned by ECR.
member.exception: The specified layer upload does not contain any layer parts.
The layer digest calculation performed by Amazon ECR upon receipt of the image layer does not match the digest specified.
The specified parameter is invalid. Review the available parameters for the API request.
The operation failed due to a KMS exception.
The image layer already exists in the associated repository.
Layer parts must be at least 5 MiB in size.
The specified repository could not be found. Check the spelling of the specified repository and ensure that you are performing operations on the correct registry.
These errors are usually caused by a server-side issue.
The upload could not be found, or the specified upload ID is not valid for this repository.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for CompleteLayerUpload Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.ECR.IAmazonECR.DescribeImages(Amazon.ECR.Model.DescribeImagesRequest)
member.summary:
Returns metadata about the images in a repository.
Beginning with Docker version 1.9, the Docker client compresses image layers before pushing them to a V2 Docker registry. The output of the docker images command shows the uncompressed image size, so it may return a larger image size than the image sizes returned by DescribeImages.

member.name: M:Amazon.ECR.IAmazonECR.GetAuthorizationToken(Amazon.ECR.Model.GetAuthorizationTokenRequest)
member.summary:
Retrieves an authorization token. An authorization token represents your IAM authentication credentials and can be used to access any Amazon ECR registry that your IAM principal has access to. The authorization token is valid for 12 hours.
The authorizationToken returned is a base64 encoded string that can be decoded and used in a docker login command to authenticate to a registry. The CLI offers an get-login-password command that simplifies the login process. For more information, see Registry authentication in the Amazon Elastic Container Registry User Guide.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the GetAuthorizationToken service method.
member.returns: The response from the GetAuthorizationToken service method, as returned by ECR.
member.exception: The specified parameter is invalid. Review the available parameters for the API request.
These errors are usually caused by a server-side issue.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for GetAuthorizationToken Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.ECR.IAmazonECR.GetDownloadUrlForLayer(Amazon.ECR.Model.GetDownloadUrlForLayerRequest)
member.summary:
Retrieves the pre-signed Amazon S3 download URL corresponding to an image layer. You can only get URLs for image layers that are referenced in an image.
When an image is pulled, the GetDownloadUrlForLayer API is called once per image layer that is not already cached.
This operation is used by the Amazon ECR proxy and is not generally used by customers for pulling and pushing images. In most cases, you should use the docker CLI to pull, tag, and push images.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the GetDownloadUrlForLayer service method.
member.returns: The response from the GetDownloadUrlForLayer service method, as returned by ECR.
member.exception: The specified parameter is invalid. Review the available parameters for the API request.
The specified layer is not available because it is not associated with an image. Unassociated image layers may be cleaned up at any time.
The specified layers could not be found, or the specified layer is not valid for this repository.
The specified repository could not be found. Check the spelling of the specified repository and ensure that you are performing operations on the correct registry.
These errors are usually caused by a server-side issue.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for GetDownloadUrlForLayer Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.ECR.IAmazonECR.InitiateLayerUpload(Amazon.ECR.Model.InitiateLayerUploadRequest)
member.summary:
Notifies Amazon ECR that you intend to upload an image layer.
When an image is pushed, the InitiateLayerUpload API is called once per image layer that has not already been uploaded. Whether or not an image layer has been uploaded is determined by the BatchCheckLayerAvailability API action.
This operation is used by the Amazon ECR proxy and is not generally used by customers for pulling and pushing images. In most cases, you should use the docker CLI to pull, tag, and push images.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the InitiateLayerUpload service method.
member.returns: The response from the InitiateLayerUpload service method, as returned by ECR.
member.exception: The specified parameter is invalid. Review the available parameters for the API request.
The operation failed due to a KMS exception.
The specified repository could not be found. Check the spelling of the specified repository and ensure that you are performing operations on the correct registry.
These errors are usually caused by a server-side issue.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for InitiateLayerUpload Operation

member.summary:
Lists all the image IDs for the specified repository.
You can filter images based on whether or not they are tagged by using the tagStatus filter and specifying either TAGGED, UNTAGGED or ANY. For example, you can filter your results to return only UNTAGGED images and then pipe that result to a BatchDeleteImage operation to delete them. Or, you can filter your results to return only TAGGED images to list all of the tags in your repository.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the ListImages service method.
member.returns: The response from the ListImages service method, as returned by ECR.
member.exception: The specified parameter is invalid. Review the available parameters for the API request.
The specified repository could not be found. Check the spelling of the specified repository and ensure that you are performing operations on the correct registry.
These errors are usually caused by a server-side issue.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for ListImages Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.ECR.IAmazonECR.PutImage(Amazon.ECR.Model.PutImageRequest)
member.summary:
Creates or updates the image manifest and tags associated with an image.
When an image is pushed and all new image layers have been uploaded, the PutImage API is called once to create or update the image manifest and the tags associated with the image.
This operation is used by the Amazon ECR proxy and is not generally used by customers for pulling and pushing images. In most cases, you should use the docker CLI to pull, tag, and push images.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the PutImage service method.
member.returns: The response from the PutImage service method, as returned by ECR.
member.exception: The specified image has already been pushed, and there were no changes to the manifest or image tag after the last push.
The specified image digest does not match the digest that Amazon ECR calculated for the image.
The specified image is tagged with a tag that already exists. The repository is configured for tag immutability.
The specified parameter is invalid. Review the available parameters for the API request.
The operation failed due to a KMS exception.
The specified layers could not be found, or the specified layer is not valid for this repository.
The operation did not succeed because it would have exceeded a service limit for your account. For more information, see Amazon ECR service quotas in the Amazon Elastic Container Registry User Guide.
The manifest list is referencing an image that does not exist.
The specified repository could not be found. Check the spelling of the specified repository and ensure that you are performing operations on the correct registry.
These errors are usually caused by a server-side issue.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for PutImage Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.ECR.IAmazonECR.PutReplicationConfiguration(Amazon.ECR.Model.PutReplicationConfigurationRequest)
member.summary:
Creates or updates the replication configuration for a registry. The existing replication configuration for a repository can be retrieved with the DescribeRegistry API action. The first time the PutReplicationConfiguration API is called, a service-linked IAM role is created in your account for the replication process. For more information, see Using service-linked roles for Amazon ECR in the Amazon Elastic Container Registry User Guide.
When configuring cross-account replication, the destination account must grant the source account permission to replicate. This permission is controlled using a registry permissions policy. For more information, see PutRegistryPolicy.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the PutReplicationConfiguration service method.
member.returns: The response from the PutReplicationConfiguration service method, as returned by ECR.
member.exception: The specified parameter is invalid. Review the available parameters for the API request.
These errors are usually caused by a server-side issue.
There was an exception validating this request.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for PutReplicationConfiguration Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.ECR.IAmazonECR.StartImageScan(Amazon.ECR.Model.StartImageScanRequest)

member.name: M:Amazon.ECR.IAmazonECR.UploadLayerPart(Amazon.ECR.Model.UploadLayerPartRequest)
member.summary:
Uploads an image layer part to Amazon ECR.
When an image is pushed, each new image layer is uploaded in parts. The maximum size of each image layer part can be 20971520 bytes (or about 20MB). The UploadLayerPart API is called once per each new image layer part.
This operation is used by the Amazon ECR proxy and is not generally used by customers for pulling and pushing images. In most cases, you should use the docker CLI to pull, tag, and push images.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the UploadLayerPart service method.
member.returns: The response from the UploadLayerPart service method, as returned by ECR.
member.exception: The layer part size is not valid, or the first byte specified is not consecutive to the last byte of a previous layer part upload.
The specified parameter is invalid. Review the available parameters for the API request.
The operation failed due to a KMS exception.
The operation did not succeed because it would have exceeded a service limit for your account. For more information, see Amazon ECR service quotas in the Amazon Elastic Container Registry User Guide.
The specified repository could not be found. Check the spelling of the specified repository and ensure that you are performing operations on the correct registry.
These errors are usually caused by a server-side issue.
The upload could not be found, or the specified upload ID is not valid for this repository.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for UploadLayerPart Operation
